nodes.bodyText: Can we add documentation around the table dimensions, for example, not sure what does the String denote here.

I will addd a comment there for clarity. String here is the name of the node level RCA. This would allow this cluster RCA to subscribe and store flowunits from multiple types of node level RCA(which might not be useful in queue cluster / cache cluster RCA )
Execute pollFirst() until the size of linkedList is less than equal to numOfFlowUnitsInMap ?
yes, this is to make sure the linked list only contains the last numOfFlowUnitsInMap  flowunits from each node
Do we need NodeKey here or just  Host IP Address should be enough ?

Having a dedicated NodeKey object as the key would make it easier for us to create the output summary.  HotNodeSummary will need both id and address and we have to maintain a separate map here to map node id -> (node id, address ip) if we use node id only as the key.

How are we getting this list of nodes within Cluster? Are we polling ES here?
If yes, then we should definitely move this to use ClusterDetailsEventProcessor now then later.

no, we are not polling ES here. This getClusterNodesDetails() read NodeDetails directly from ClusterDetailsEventProcessor. And the reason why I create a private method getClusterNodesDetails() here is to check whether we want to include master node or not in the final summary report. (some node level RCA might not run on master so we don't want to add the master nodes into the node list)
We can add a log statement here describing the inactiveNodes and their removal from nodeTable
done

generateFlowUnit() is invoked after removeInactiveNodeFromNodeMap(), where we refresh the active node lists.
We shouldn't be refreshing the list again here while generating flow units but instead, the consumer(decider) should take care of discarding any flowunits from inactive nodes.

Suppose a node went down and came back up, the node will have the same hostAddress but the nodeId would change.
So, for such a case, we should ideally not treat this node as a new node and thus, match here based on the hostAddress. Thoughts?
that is a good point. let's discuss with @vigyasharma on this and see what is the best approach
Had a discussion with Vigya and he said in newer ES versions,  both node ip and es node id are same after es restarts.
Given that this holds for all versions post ES5, I think we can safely use nodeID here.

String based hashCode methods are inconsistent across different process and machines. Can we use something like below :
HashCodeBuilder(17, 37)
            .append(nodeId)
            .toHashCode();
done

We can 2 things here:

declare the table nodeTable as protected, so in case we want to add other functionality in the sub class, we have access to nodeTable
Instead of declaring the table in base class, we declare it in subclass and pass it around as a parameter.
Should this class also keep track of the fact that all NodeLevel RCAs are received within a time window or mark the node as unhealthy for missing heartbeat ?

we store timestamp as part of the flowunits in that 2D table. And it is up to the derived class to decide whether missing heartbeat needs to be considered or not. Any derived class can override the generateNodeSummary() method to re-implement the function to keep track of missing heartbeat. the default method will simple ignore the node if the flowunit is too stale and it does not receive flowunit from that particular node for a certain amount of time (default is set to 10 mins)
If we are building a base class for all RCA types, can we keep the HotClusterSummary part generic so that TemperatureProfile RCAs can make use of it as well ?

As per out discussion, I will create separate base class for cluster summary and node summary so that we can make the  output flowunit generic. Let me address it in a separate PR. will create a issue for that
Can't this be done inside the above for loop?
Great that we updated the equals and hashCode method here to include hostAddress
